title: Degrees of Freedom at the Hand Joints
summary: Compare CMC, MCP, PIP, and DIP motions with quick icons and clinical tie-ins so learners can predict movement loss patterns.
high_yield: Thumb CMC is saddle (flex/ext, abd/add, opposition); digits 2–5 are plane.
MCP joints allow flex/ext + abd/add + circumduction (except thumb).
PIP/DIP are hinge only—tie to splint positioning.
pitfalls: Thumb MCP has limited abduction—clarify during the MCP section.
Students mix up passive vs. active ROM norms; include quick numerical cues (e.g., MCP flex 90°).

animation_timeline.narration: Introduce a joint stack infographic from proximal (CMC) to distal (DIP).
animation_timeline.visual: Vertical stack with joint icons and DOF badges.

animation_timeline.narration: Animate thumb CMC showing opposition path versus a plane glide for the ring finger CMC.
animation_timeline.visual: Split animation: thumb sweeping across palm, ring finger sliding minimally.

animation_timeline.narration: Highlight MCP flexion/extension plus abduction by toggling between fists and splayed fingers; end with hinge-only IP joints.
animation_timeline.visual: Hand silhouette flexing to fist then abducting digits, followed by hinge animation at PIP/DIP.
